Sentencas: The development of active cathodes is one of the most critical challenges to lowering the operating temperature for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Enhancement of low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell performance and durability via surface chemistry modification

Sentencas: Here we demonstrated that by modifying the cathode surface chemistry at a relatively low temperature, the cathode activity and durability can be simultaneously enhanced on high-performing, low-temperature cathodes such as (La0.6Sr0.4)0.95Co0.2Fe0.8O3-8 (LSCF) and Sr0.5Sm0.5CoO3-8 (SSC).
Titulo: Enhancement of low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell performance and durability via surface chemistry modification

Sentencas: This low-temperature modification using multi-valent cations activates the highly defected surface and maintains the nanoscale electrocatalysts by bypassing the high-temperature sintering procedure for SOFC fabrication.
Titulo: Enhancement of low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell performance and durability via surface chemistry modification

Sentencas: The modified cathode at 600 degrees C shows an order of magnitude reduction in impedance to only 0.05 omega cm2 with a peak power density of 1.1 W/cm2 and increases stability over 2000 h.
Titulo: Enhancement of low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell performance and durability via surface chemistry modification

Sentencas: The combination of in situ characterization, distribution of relaxation time analysis on impedance spectroscopy, and surface chemistry analysis reveals the importance of surface chemistry control on the gas-solid reaction activity and durability and provides the design principle for numerous future solid oxide cells.
Titulo: Enhancement of low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell performance and durability via surface chemistry modification
